Source.Name: licq
Source.Description: Licq is a multi-threaded ICQ (originally; now it supports AOL and MSN as well) clone written mostly in C++. It uses an extensive plugin system to manage many different functions.

Package.Name: licq-osd
Package.Description: On Screen Display (OSD) plugin display messages on the screen transparently as soon as they are received.

Package.Name: licq-rms
Package.Description: This plugin opens a TCP server on the Licq box which allows you to telnet in and perform commands and get information. It works with the new licqweb web interface. It acts much like the FIFO only it is two way. Currently it supports viewing/changing status, viewing the user list, viewing groups, sending messages/urls, and dumping the network log.

Package.Name: licq-console
Package.Description: This is a console interface plugin for Licq using ncurses. It features multiple command windows, and much of the basic icq functionality.

Package.Name: licq-forwarder
Package.Description: A simple plugin to forward incoming ICQ events to either an email address or another ICQ account. This is great for forwarding a secondary ICQ account or forwarding to a pager/mobile phone. Also included in the main distribution.

Package.Name: licq-autoreply
Package.Description: Plugin to automatically respond to any incoming event with the output of a given program, which can be passed user arguments, or event the message text itself. Often used in conjunction with "fortune" to send people fortunes.

Package.Name: licq-web
Package.Description: licqweb is a Web frontend for licq. It interfaces with the Remote Management Service plugin and uses AJAX to provide real-time communication. It is useful for people who use IMs from multiple locations and want a 'centralised' application that means no more logging off and on, consolidates chat history to the one location, and prevents problems where messages are missed because another IM client received them.

Update.Comment: Version bump: * GUI ported to QT4. * New tray icon handling that will work on any desktop with a standard tray area. * Various bugs in both Licq and plugins that caused crashes have been fixed. * Properly handle backslashes in auto responses. * ICQ: Use MD5 based authentication for login instead of sending plain text password. * ICQ: Support for downloading contact pictures from server. * ICQ: Line breaks in received messages from some clients were lost. * ICQ: Manually set aliases were sometimes lost during logon. * ICQ: Files were left open after canceled transfers. * MSN: Sometimes sockets were getting associated with the wrong conversation. * MSN: Fixed a problem with contact pictures sometimes failing to download. * Show contact registration date in user info dialog. * GUI will now update if group data changes. * Startup group setting moved from daemon to GUI. * Automatically switch message dialog to text message after sending file, contact, url, etc. * Birthday icon is now removed at the end of the day. * Main window position/size is now saved on exit. * User info can be opened from authorization request window. * Fixed ICQ server port resetting to default when opening options dialog. * Establishing a secure connection now unchecks "Send through server". * User info dialog now includes year in all dates. * Buttons for most dialogs are ordered to match the local environment. * Message dialog has new layout which uses less space for the controls. * Settings dialog pages has been reorganized with fewer options per page for easier navigation. * User info dialog has been extended to also include pages with user settings. * Settings dialog and user info dialog now uses a navigation-tree pane instead of tabs. * A completely new history dialog with easier navigation and search functionality. * Message dialog remember its position and size (tabbed mode only). * Option to display user image in message dialog. * Contact list shows contacts awaiting authorization in different colour. * Fixed deleting a user caused the contact list to behave strange or even crash. * Moved Qt style setting from command line to settings dialog. * Moved skin and icon set selections to settings dialog. * Alt+1, Alt+2, etc in message dialog can be used to switch between tabs. * Made keyboard shortcuts configurable. * Several additional functions can be configured to have keyboard shortcuts. * Added option to disable sound for active message window. * Size of view event and send event dialogs are remembered. * Current group in contact list can be changed using scroll wheel on message field. * Shift+PgUp/PgDn in message input can be used to scroll history area. * Added spell checking support for message dialog. * Thread contact list can be split in online and offline parts (group mode 2).
